text: Pale yellow with medium white head very like an industry pale lager. The aroma is really delicious, orange, mandarin hoppy, very fresh. Taste doesn´t follow the nice aroma, lacks some body. Initially dry and hoppy but the body is a little weak.

Gylden og lettere diset Premium Lager med flygtig hvidlig skumkrone på 1-2 cm, som svinder til et par mm. 
Ganske frugtrig aroma af tropisk frugt som papaya, melon og noter af citrus. 
Smagen er ganske humlebitter, men også med klare frugtnoter. Frisk i udtrykket med en fin balance mellem frugtsødme og bitterhed. 
Øllet har en middel fyldig krop med en tynd konsistens. Karboneret på et medium niveau og med en tør bitter afslutning. 
Overall: Let drikkelig, frisk, humlet og velafbalanceret Pale Ale/Premium Lager. 
330 ml, flaske, 5.0 % ABV, BB: 14/02/17, købt i Meny på Borups Allé på Frederiksberg. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy yellow, long lasting head. Mild aroma with notes of citrus, hops and light sweet malt.
Easyli drinkable with light hoppy notes

Bottle. Pours clear pale golden with small white head. Aroma is grain, rust, sea water, engine oil, pear, apples, gooseberry and hints of passion fruit. Taste is medium acidic, medium bitter and light sweet. Body is light oily with fizzy carbonation. Finish is long and mostly bitter with notes of yogurt, grain, sour apples, raspberry, gooseberry and apple vinegar.

Bottle split at Kenny 20k, 15/01/16.
Clear golden orange with a decent off White covering.
Nose is pale malts, citric zest, straw, orange, toasted grains. 
Taste comprises tangerine, straw, light bread dough, pale malts, lemon tinged.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Solid lager.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle from Kihoskh. From the bottle but my guess would be clear golden pour with a fluffy head. Notes of sweet malts, light syrupy sweetness, grainy and some green grass.

How: Bottle.
Where: Kihoskh, Copenhagen.
Appearance: Clear golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Fruit, sweet malt, citrus, yeast.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Fruit, hops, grass, citrus.

Copenhagen 13/5 2016. 33 cl bottle from Meny. Crying woman (looks like Saison Sally) fleeing guy with hat who shouts "Døszt" on the label. Pours slightly hazy golden yellow with big white head. Settles as 1 cm thick layer of foam. A lot of lacing on the side of the glass. Aroma is sweet and fruity. Peach, mango and dark lightly fermented fruit. Sourish citric notes. Medium carbonation and slightly thick palate. Taste is medium sweet followed by more pronounced bitterness. Aftertaste is bitter as well with semi dry finish. No reason to run away from this one, Sally.

Bottle in Copenhagen-- Pours hazy orange with thick white head, nice lacing. Nose is flowery. Aromas are toasted malts, flowery and herbal hops, apricot. Average carbonation, medium body. Long bitter and herbal finish. Very enjoyable, especially on a sunny café terrace in Copenhagen!

Bottle. Pours towards clear golden with a white head. Aroma of bitter grassy hops, grainy notes, citrus and orange. The taste is bitter and crisp with bready notes and slight malty notes as well. Crisp and refreshing hoppy lager!
light grass hoppy aroma,golden, clear, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, light bitter finish.
Golden coloured and almost clear. Has a white head, medium duration. Fruity, sweet aroma, notes of sweet flour. Flavor starts sweet, finish light bitter.

Bottle shared at the Kenny 20K mega monster tasting. 15/01/2016. Many thanks to Chris? Clear bright golden light orange coloured our with a small loose white head. Aroma is decent, lemon, floral, lemon, pollen, nice hop. Flavour is composed of light bready biscuity grains, pithy lemon, floral pollen, Palate is light, semi sweet, some carbonation, Lingering decent tropical fruit.

Bottle share at Chrisos for Kennys 20K. Thanks! As Mikkeller Kihoskh Døszt?, 5%. Dark orange, still, clear, small foamy dense off-white head, dotted lacing. Aroma is pine, flowers, pez sweets, touch of bubblegum. Body is quite foamy, soft carbonation. Taste follows the aroma with pine, flowery hops and some salt in the finish. Very drinkable stuff.

Present from Laura, James, and Jack. Pours almost clear yellow with white head with decent retention. Hoppy, citrussy aroma. Tast also dominated by citrus-fresh hop, floral notes, fresh bread and a little honey sweetness. Aftertaste dry and bitter, but not overly so. Very refreshing, light and well balanced.

33cl bottle shared at Kennys 20K celebrations @Chrisos, thanks to Chris. It pours a Clean pale golden color with medium white head. Aroma is sweet fruity lightly biscuity and resiny quite hoppy. Taste is quite hoppy fruity lightly sweet and resiny. Light to medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, quite tasty
Bottle at Madmitch 20k. Some hop aroma. Some rose fruit. Fresh. OK. Some hop on end quite fruity. Fine.
Once again a strong brew from Mikkeller. This is a refreshing and slightly hoppy lager.
Flaska (tack NordicV). Klar guldfärgad med ett stort och långvarigt vitt skum. Dofter och smaker av blomster, citrus, mango och persika. Medelbeska. Medel mot liten kropp. Fin öl.

Bottle from trade with Plovmand, many thanks! Leicht trübe orangegelbe Farbe, mittelgroße weiße Schaumkrone. Geruch dezent hopfig, fruchtig, leicht hefig. Geschmack leicht hefig, angenehme dezent Bitterkeit, leicht fruchtig, süffig, schlanker Körper.
Bottle. Pours hazy light amber with a medium off white head. The aroma is very fruity hoppy. Light malty notes. The flavor is bitter and fruity hoppy with Pilsner yeasty notes. Bitter finish.
[5/3/15] Draught at Taphouse in Copenhagen. Clear amber. Aroma of caramel and some piney hops. Sweetish flavor with caramel and bitterish hops.

Bottle. Clear copper with a large frothy off white head. Hoppy nose; citrus, light pot, cheese. Light bodied with hop driven flavour, mostly citrus, flowers, honey, light white bread. Mild sweet, light bitter and dry hoppy finish. Refreshing, easy going.
Tap at Pale Ale Festival. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma and taste Tropical fruit, Peach, hopforward, light malts. Bitter and sweet ending.
Flaska från kylen på Kihoskh (såklart) drucken i vårsolen. En torr, krispig och väldigt fruktigt humlad lager med måttlig beska. Massor av passionsfrukt, persika, ananas och citrus. Riktigt trevlig.
Bottle. Fantastic taste. Very hoppy and fruity. A real american IPA. A farvorite in spe...
33 cl. bottle. Clear golden colour with a nice white head. Aroma and flavour of hops, citrus, peach, bitterness and spicy.

This one must be one of the few bad beers I have tasted from Mikkeller. The aroma is full of butter and pretty much nothing else. The color though is beautifully golden. The taste is full of butter and nothing else. A disappointing experience from one of the world best craft beer makers.
Cerveja de origem belga, leve, amarga, cítrica e frutada. Vale a pena experimentar.

Bottle from Magasin du Nord, Kongens Nytorv, CPH - pours gold with a good white head. Citrus fruity aroma and taste, refreshing citric zesty satsuma and lemon, some grassy and floral hoppy notes, lovely quaffable brew (even at 5% abv)

A forgotten bottle that I bought at Kihoskh in November 2012. 

Clear golden with a medium white head. Aroma of grass, caramel, some light grapefruit and malt. Similar taste. Soft and easy to drink. Old but still ok.

29.08.2014, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly harsh floral, weeds, grass, citrus peel, alcohol, leafs, hay, yeast, harsh hops. Taste is slightly harsh grassy, leafs, harsh hops, lawn, pine needles, citrus peel, alcohol, bark, soap. Longlasting bitterness, slightly dry harsh mouthfeel. Not my cup of tea.

Bottle. Pours slightly unclear pale amber with medium off-white head. Strong nose of tropical fruit, especially passion fruit. Complex aroma of tropical fruits, hay, hops, sweet malts, some spiciness. Taste is medium, good bitter / sweet balance. Palate has a slightly astringent attack.

Pours a slightly cloudy nectarine with a medium white head. Aromas of tangerine, peach, honey, caramel and some spices. Taste is tangerine and peach that gives way to some spices along with grapefruit tones. Body is sprightly with medium carbonation.

Gylden brun klar med høyt kremete offwhite skum. Humle, grapefrukt og lukt av sydhavsfrukter. Smaler lett sitrus og lett humle men likevel en fyldig følelse. Mer humle i avslutningen. Godt med kullsyre
Bottle. Hazy amber pour with creamy white head. Fresh aroma with just a hint of flowers. Has instant but pleasant bitterness. Nice hoppy touch for a lager
Bottle. Golden-orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma is hop, malt, peaches, apricot. Flavour is hop, malt, peaches, citrus, apricot. Bitter finish. Medium body. Ordinary beer.
Bottle. Creamy White good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and heavy hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Average moderate bittter finish. Oily palate. Nice.
Bottle from Kihoskh. Fruity smell with hops, citrus and tropical fruits. Similar taste. Strong but also smooth bitterness. Easy to drink summer beer.

330 ml bottle. Hazy golden body with a small white head. Aroma of ripe fruit, apricot and mango with some malt. Flavor is sweet fruity, some malt and balanced bitterness. Medium body and bitter aftertaste with fruit. Nice and very pleasant this one.
A fruity aroma. Flavor is fruity bitter with notes of berries and a fresh aftertaste. Color is amber with a white head.

Bottle. An unclear, orange-golden beer with a small, off-white head. The aroma has hints of cat-pee, with tropical fruits like apricot and mango. Not much maltyness. The flavor too is fruity, tropical fruits mostly. Bitter flavor, too bitter I think, with mostly bitter finish. Medium to full body and a nice carbonation level. Bitter, fruity finish. Nice indeed, but too beer to be a session beer, but one or two would be nice. 140110
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear amber with a white head that leaves a lot of lacing. Aroma and flavour is tropical fruits, pine, and caramel  with a slightly bitter finish.

330 ml bottle courtesy of Jacob. Thanks. Pours a translucent brass color with a medium white head that has good retention. The aroma is fairly pungent for a pale lager with some citrus, cedar, hay and grass. The taste mirrors the aroma with a very nice citrus flavor, mild oranges in particular, more grass, hay and some sawdust. The palate was a bit thin but was very appropriate for the beer. Carbonation was light but slightly prickly. Finished long and dry with lingering citrus hops. Overall: Perhaps my favorite pale lager ever. Well done Mikkeller.

Bottle 330ml @ Geokkjer
Pours clear deep golden with a white head. Aroma has notes malt, citrus and tropical fruits. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium bitter with a long fruity finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.
Bottle.Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of citrus, kiwi, some lemon and fruitiness. Flavor is sweet and bitter with some citrus and floral hops. Medium to thin body, average carbonation.
Bärnstensfärgad med stort vit skum! Mycket citrus och tropiska frukter i doft och smak! Väldigt fräsch med bra beska och inslag av jäst och alkohol

Medium offwhite head. Clear amber body until dregs are poured
in, at which point it becomes hazy. Sharp citric tropical fruit
aroma with pine needle notes. Dryish tropical fruit and citrus
taste with herbal funky notes. Mid-bodied. Sharpish mouthfeel.
Dryish wooden tropical fruit aftertaste with catty chalky notes.
Its quite nice, but a bit chalky for me. (0.33l bottle, from
Kihoskh, Copenhagen.)

@ Havregatan. Flaska från Kihoskh, Köpenhamn. Inte alls vad man förknippar med en lager! I positiv bemärkelse! Rejält humlig doft och smak. Massor av grape, ananas, tallbarr. Medelfyllig, ganska torr med en hyfsat besk och lång eftersmak.

Bottled. Pours golden with and slighly hazy and a small, off-white, lacing head. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruit notes and caramel. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and slightly bitter. Light to medium bodied, oily text. and soft carb. A lovely ale indeed.
Trevlig och pigg humle. Direkt ur flaskan innan tåget går. Lyckad helg. Trevlig butik

Bottle from Kihøskh, bb 23/05/15Hazy deep blond color with small creamy head. It has a nice fresh aroma of tropical fruits, peach and some mango. The mouthfeel is quite smooth and absolutely dry; strong bitterness, with nice tropical fruit presence; the final is a bit papery, with some bitter oranges and hop resins too.Very nice summer beer, quite sessionable.

Clear golden colour, white head. Hoppy aroma, citrus, passion fruit, light sweet touch. Bitter flavour, hops, light bubblegum, very fresh. Quite thin body, finish hops, malts and citrus. Nice one. Interesting, but deviates quite a lot from a classic lager. Not that Im complaining though ;)
(From 33cL bottle shared @ Tims new place)

15/VII/13 - 33cl bottle @ home - BB: 6/III/15 (2013-639) Thanks to Tinus for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark orange beer, creamy off-white head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: passion fruit, some caramel, pineapple, mango. Mf: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: some citrus, bitter hops, lemon peel, little bit of honey. Aftertaste: pretty bitter, citrus, pineapple.

From Salling, Aarhus, DK.
Bottled, 150713.
Amber with white head. Aroma of fruit and spices. Flavour with some caramel and citrus.
Bottle @ Christers. Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma of malt, fruity hops, peach, citrus. Flavor is malt, nice fruity hops, peach. Medium body, lively carbonation. 030713
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is rich hops, flowers, malt, citrus and pine. Nice.
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and rather hoppy - peach. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 030713

Bottle. Slightly hazy golden with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, spicy and a little grapefruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, hop, spicy, grapefruit, little sweet, caramel and medium bitter.
Bottle. Clear golden amber bubbly beer with a small offwhite head. Hoppy and fruity aroma and similar flavour.

Bottle from Kihoskh cons 2013-04-29 Göteborg
AR: lemon punch, grape tonic,
AP: clear copper, high frothy golden whitish steady head
F: lemon pastills, grape fruit bitterness, lively carbonation, wee oily texture, refreshing but lack of sweetness for me

Vi testet basisrefleksene siste dagen i København: røv til bænk, flaske til mund og pant til kihoskh. Vi besto de to første, panten ble tatt av en panter. En rigtig lækker ipa, perfekt å nyte rett frra flasken i parken, men den når ikke helt opp til IPALOT.

Bottle @ benzai during an intense scrabble match. Hazy orange colour with a medium white head. Smells hops, fruity, fresh, apricot, sweet. Tastes very fruity, sweet, fresh, hops, bitter. Im pretty sure this isnt a premium lager. Medium body, great carbo.
Gedronken met benzai en dutchdrebus, oranje/gele kleur, witte schuimkraag, ruikt en smaakt hoppig, beetje fruitig, abrikozen

Bottle @ home shared with Dutchdrebus and Ansjelaah. Very hazy yellow to orange color, medium sized, fair lacing, white head. Smell malts, hops, fruityness of apricot. Taste malts, hops, fruityness of apricot, nice bitterness. Guess this is a very hoppy premium lager then? Low to medium body, medium carbonation.

Bottle (33 cl) from Kihosk, Copenhagen, Denmark. Clear deep golden, medium white head. Fresh tropical fruit aroma with gooseberries and oranges. Light to medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry, medium bitterness.

Bottle from Kihoskh, Copenhagen. Pours cloudy golden with a big creamy white head. Aroma of kiwi,pine and grass. Taste is bitter and dry, lots of citrus and pine, fresh and crisp hops, very nice beer.

Bottle 33cl kihoskh. enjoyed in the summer breeze at Besser Rev, Samsø. Body is bright deep yellow with an orangey shade. Firm white top. Inviting fruity hop aroma. Tangerines, apricots and peaches, and a whiff of summerflowers. The same goes for the flavor. Deliciously fruity!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from the Kihoskh, Copenhagen!   Poured a clear medium amber with a frothy white head, some broken lace and lots of carbonation.  The aroma is hoppy and aromatic, leading to a medium to high bitter flavour, with lots of hops on the palate and in the aftertaste.  This beer wasnt expensive and its surprisingly good and very refreshing.  But then again, its from Mikkeller so nothing should surprise me!

Bottle from Kihoskh, shared september 29th with esp0r&simonsen. Clear golden body, medium white head. Aroma of citrus fruits, dry lager yeast, grassy hops. Taste is fruity, peach and lemon, pine. Dry nice palate, lasting bitterness with a crisp malty and citrus aftertaste

27th July 2012Hazy amber beer, good off white head. Light palate, start crisp but quickly turns softer. Minerals. Mild creamy malt. Mild brett. Really nice sweet tropical fruits. Peach, a little mango. Minor bitter pith. Soft finish with a touch of salty brett. Mild carbonated bite. Delightful little beer!
Light brown. White head. Fruity caramel malt nose. Hints of hops, yeast and fruit. Good lager
Clear golden. White foam on top. Moldy oranges in the nose.  Taste is yeasty and fruity.

33 cl. bottle. Clear, golden colour with a medium sized, bubbly white head. Aroma with lots of fruits and hops: Exotic fruits, citrus, flowers, hay and caramel malts. Taste is bitter and fruity. Medium body, creamy texture, lively carbonation, light soapy. Long lasting bitter finish with grasses and citrus fruits. High drinkability in this lager.

0.33 l bottle at Timo As. Slightly hazy deep golden color. Firm hoppy aroma with lemon, pine, onions, . Bitter, citrusy and nutty taste with lemon and pine. Medium body. Salty bitter finish. Tasty hoppy apa.

Bottle. Clear golden beer with a quite nice offwhite head. Pineapple aroma, peach, grapes, mango, raisins, pears, pine, biscuits, sweetish notes, citrus, caramel, lemon, spicy notes. Hoppy pine flavor, mango, quite bitter, spicy notes, citrus, pineapples, citrus, caramel, grapefruit notes. Nice fresh bitter finish with pine, mango and citrus. Very refreshing.

Bottle 330ml.Clear medium yellow orange colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, hay, toasted, fruity, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, tropical fruit, orange - citrus, cat piss. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, citrus, fruity. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120829]

Bottle shared at the daje & esp0r hits #1000 rates sessions
Golden hazy, white head. Smells of mandarin, malts and some cat pee. Light to moderate sweet, quite dry and crisp. Medium bitter, some resins and zests. A quite nice beer, sure not traditionally hopped
Drukket på hytt til dag med ølentusiaster, gylden farge med fint skum, smaker humle og mandarin

Bottled. Golden coloured. Unclear. Small beige head. Aroma: herbs, some flowers, peach and other tropicál fruits, light sweetness. Flavour: tropical fruits, rape, flowers. Medium to full bodied. Ends on a sweetish bitterness. Refreshing and pleasant.

Several 0.33 L bottles purchased @KIhoskh, enjoyed in the summer breeze at Besser Rev, Samsø. Body is bright deep yellow with an orangey shade. Firm white top. Inviting fruity hop aroma. Tangerines, apricots and peaches, and a whiff of summerflowers. The same goes for the flavor. Deliciously fruity. Sweet citrus such as tangerines and oranges. Mixed bag tropical with nice peachy flavor in the lead. Mild, yet distinct bitterness. Some gently sweet toasted malts in the back. Juicy mouthfeel. Smooth. Nice lingering fruity hop finish. What a lager! What a treat!
Pours amber with a white head. Aroma is caramel, citrus, grapefruit and peach. Flavour is caramel, peach, citrus, grapefruit and tropical fruit.

Pours a clear and golden beer with a white head. The aroma is malt and hops with peach, grapefruit, tropical fruit and citrus. The flavor follows the nose. The palate is sweetness and some bitterness. Overall a good beer.

33 cl bottle @ vPBF.
Pours hazy golden-amber color with small head. Aroma of fruits, resin, mild hops and malts. Flavor of fruits, hops, malts, mild grassy notes and some toffee. Bitter palate, dry finish.
3313

Bottled 330ml (vPBF)
Golden color, good white head, some lace. Tropical fruity, hoppy aroma. Light bodied. Crisp carbonation. Flavor has also tropical fruityness. Pale maltyness, a bit thin malt side but nice lager.

33 cl bottle @ vPBF, BBE 22.05.2014
Aroma is slightly sweet with hops and peaches, some exotic fruits, hints of resin and caramel. Flavour is hoppy with exotic fruits, some gooseberry bush and hints of nettles. Could have a stronger backbone. But refreshing and good anyway.

330 ml bottle @ vPBF 2012.
Pours a hazy golden colour with a white head. Aroma of strong floral hops, grass and some orange. Flavour of strong floral hops, grass, grainy malts, orange and citric tartness. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and a good bitter, light grainy and fruity finish. Good hoppy burbs. Nice one.

330ml bottle @ vPBF

Pours light orange with a foamy head.
Strong hoppy and fruity aroma with notes of grapefruit and caramel.
Hoppy and fruity taste with notes of grass, grapefruit, caramel, bready malts and hints of spices.
Finish is fruity and bitter with some grassy and floral hops. Tasty, well balanced and hoppy lager.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Golden colour, mediumsized white head. Aroma is fruity, sweet malts, tropical fruits and some slight earthyness. Flavour is fruity, floral, grassy and some slight bready maltyness and mild biscuits as well.

12oz bottle bought at Kihoskh pours a clear orange with one ring of white head.  Nose is just like an IPA, American hops, citrus, a little cat pee, grapefruit, lemon, light pine.  Flavor is well balanced, some light honey sweetness, grapefruit, pine, lemon, orange zest, spring onions.  Finish is clean, dry and zesty.  A well hopped lager is going to be the next big thing and this one is exemplary.

Bottle. slightly golden with a small white head. Complex and intriguing hop aroma - peach, melon, passion fruit, that kinda stuff. Light body and light malt profile, sweet but not that sweet, that pairs well with the very tropical-fruity hops. Finish is in zen-like balance - not too sweet, not too bitter. Sexy MF of a gun. With high drinkability.

330 ml bottle. Hazy sparkling amber colour. Medium-sized fluffy white head that clings to the glass. Delicious peach and mango aroma. Refreshing hoppy bitterness. Medium-bodied. Well balanced and very drinkable. I love the hop profile, which is very nice.

Bottle. Almost clear, amber liquid with small to medium off-white head. Aroma of citrus, grapefruit, simcoe (?) hops, tangerine, sweet cereal and a bit lager yeast. Taste is dry and light to medium bitter with some fruity hops. Medium bodied with medium carbonation and quite smooth mouthfeel. Nice, refreshing and hoppy.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours golden with a slight haze and a smallish white head. Lovely complex and sophisticated hop aroma - is there perhaps a little Sorachi Ace here? Light body, a light initial sweetness but then this lovely tropical fruit melange from the great blend of aroma hops. Not overly bitter though. Lovely quaffer. 030812

Bottle shared.  Pours clear golden with an off white head.  Aroma initially surprises with lovely tropical fruit hops and grapefruit.  Flavour is light sweet and medium to heavy bitter.  Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.  Excellent, and a lot more like an IPA than a lager.

33cl bottle courtesy of Kermis.
Thin white head.  lovely citrus aroma.  hazy blond pour.  Great grapefruit bitterness.  possibly the best lager in the world ;-)

Hazy deep golden colour, medium white head. Fresh exotic fruity piney hoppy like bit funky aroma. Good mouthfeel. Fresh pleasant exotic fruity piney citrus hoppy funky flavour with a medium bitterness. One hell of a kick butt good Premium Lager.

Bottle from Kihoskh. 
Golden yellow with a small head. Soft carbonation.
Tropical fruits dominate the aroma; Mango, peach but some pine as well.
Aroma is hoppy fresh, some grapefruit and has a nice bitterness that kicks in at the end. 
Lager?  Feels more like a pale ale. Really nice for a hot summers evening.
Flaske> Gulorange klar l med et stort skumhoved. Fantastisk duft af humle, en smule kattepis sagde konen, men jeg havde mest frisk citrus. Smagen sad ogs[ lige i skabet. Dejlig dejlig sommerl.
Pee and fruity hops on the nose. Light body - hops dominate the taste. Peach, rye bread bitterness and pineapple on the taste.

Nose: hops, vegetate, pine, resin
Taste: resiny hops, vegetate, 
Aftertaste:bitter hops

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Markhaven Summer Fun 2012. Dark golden with a lasting white head. Tropical fruit aroma with peach and kiwi, and a touch of malt. Dry and fruity flavour with a nice sneaking bitterness. Simple but very, very pleasant drinker
Bottle @ Odense Tasting, July 2012. Pours cloudy golden with a small white head. Nose has lots of peach, kiwi and pine. Freshly hopped. Dry and bitter. Orange. Crisp. Nice quaffer.

Draft @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours a slightly hazy golden orange color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity peachy hoppy aroma. Fruity malty grainy hoppy peachy flavor. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy hoey finish.

Bottle. Medium high fluffy white head. Clear light amber golden body. Oranges peach aroma. Fruity lemon grapefruit flavor with notes of nuts grass and pine with a nicy hops bitterness. Low carbonation. Long bitter finish.

23-JUN-2012, bottle @Henrik, from "Kihoskh", @Ulkløbben sommerfest.
Orange with lasting low off-white head.
Hoppy nose with grape fruit, pine, and even a little funk?
Taste is grape fruit, pine, exotic fruits, candy, a little earth. No way this is a lager:-)

Bottle at home.
Clear orange coloured with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, pine needles and grapefruits.
Fruity flavour of hops, peaches and grapefruits with notes of pine needles.
Hoppy finish.

Bottle, bought @ Kihoskh, Cph.Hazy orange golden with a big, firm, creamy, off-white head. Aroma has mild peppery notes, some caramel, grapefruit, light oranges. Medium carbonation, fairly light and good dryness. Flavour is elegant, clean, hoppy. Crisp maltiness even if it feel a tad sugary. Good piney bitterness with lemons, light resin and grapefruit as well. Lingering fine light bitter finish with a touch of white pepper.

Bottle at home.
Clear golden with a large head, so nice lacings. Aroma light to medium malty (caramel), almost heavy hoppy (citrus, piney). Flavor light sweet, medium bitter. Medium body. Nice.
tap at mikkeller bar, clear orange, small white head. Bitter flowery hoppy aroma. Crisp, flavor is hops, bitterness, dry good

From kihoskh drank this from the bottle while sitting in the sun. Aroma is very fruity, I get a lot of mango, PassIonfruit, peach and an overall aroma of tropical fruits, some pineapple, very fruity sweet, light caramel and some pine. Taste: very citrussy, peachy, very high fruity sweetness, some pine, caramel, pineapple, Plantsap, a bit light bodied, medium low bitterness, but the presence is there, ends quite dry. Very enjoyable and very easy to drink. A bit inoffensive  great session beer though.

33 cl bottle. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is peachy and mango fruity, tropical fruity. Smooth fruity, peachy and mango, passion fruit. Smooth fruityand light bitter finish.

Bottled. a dark golden beer with a huge yellowish head. the aroma has notes of spicy hops, lemons, and malt. the flavor is sweet with notes of caramel, spicy hops, and malt, leading to a bitter finish. Thanks yespr for sharing.

Bottle at home - shared with Mette. Nice fresh hoppy, sweet fruity hoppy, knækbrød, toasted, light cookies, nice freshness, light light bitterness, flowery, light zesty, resin notes. Nice high drinkability - maybe a bit too much candy sweetnes.
Bottle.Bought at Kihoskh.Golden colour with medium white head.Aroma of hops and malt,medium body with fresh crispy taste and light malty taste,light and,mild grainy.
